creature nothing el idolatry doe set vnto themselues good end aime creator needes worship owne fancie swaruing aside superstition rather worse seruing owne fancie god among residue one hath eye creator honoureth lawe religion iewes againe way leaueth v middes way leading v wood leading v againe true religion deede deserueth name religion hath god hir shooteanker woord warrant hir worshipping meane appoynted pacifie hym withal onely none resteth saluation tell v religion nothing el charitiean obiection say performing mannes duetie towards neighbour men would tell v durst religion instrument ciuil gouernment haue inlarged commendation charitie farre woord say say thereof namely charitie force weight religion meanes stand without neuerthelesse speake properly thereof charitie marke whereby discrene true religion rather discerne ryghtly religious intent man may bee happye must returne vnto god therefore must need serue badge religion godly religious man vttereth religion say god hath touched truely hart performeth dewties vnfeyned freendship godly affection towards neybor image god charitie therefore nothing el rebounding godlynes loue god backe vnto neybour reflexion sigh vpon image also man may happye must linked vnto god may linked vnto god must reconciled fauor charitie speake linking man vnto man maketh man happie neither doth fault hath destroyed v consist want charitie meane charitie pretend rebelling ageinst god therefore booteth v one neybour except one god neuerthelesse good signe hart seruent loue god child ye loue father vnable yet vnite selues vnto link selues one body one mind al beare image short true marke fire heate thing whot well fire vertew linked vnto soone ye heare fire followeth immediatly heate also contrarywise lykewise charitie true religion vertue accompanieth necessitie man sooner say religion man man must need followe incontinently charitie also maner charitie soothly take refreyne misdealing feare mannes lawe hipocrisie desire credit may haue better speede affayres chaffaring desire honor whereby wee spurred dowel self loue certeine feare loue god maketh v cherish loue god sake hold man dareth vaunt perfect charitie one end namely returning vnto god one ryght path leade thether religion one god one true religion say one way leadeth saluation religion hath three vnfallible mark whereby discerne namely woorship sacrifize victory vnto god aegipt notwithstanding many number seemed haue giuen law nation round went ierusalem acknowledging himselfe haue receyued prosperitie god israell consecrate monumets victory scattered among people parted amog nation earth pleasure enemy gotten vpper hand surely god wonderful prouidence noted case farre without comparison people conquered ye whole world force armes thing poet haue written wee see contempt men yet let v heare wonderment made thereat common person great philosopher seneca seneca booke superstition yet notwithstanding saith custome nation hath preuailed rather receyued whole world beeing vanquished haue wote meanes giuen lawes conquerours seeth great motion mynd philosopher man hauing common reason rauished thereat well possible king haue subdewed people could neuer inforce chaunge owne lawes example thereof iewrie hath bin trodden vnder foote assyrian persian greekes romaine yet chaunging maysters could neuer bee brought alter lawe may perchaunce like constancie bee found among nation respect lawes people conquered caryed away brought bondage vnaccounted led triumph diuers empyres iewes subdue hart conquerours god conquerours could fasten lawes vppon vanquished sort contrarywise vanquished sort haue fastened lawes vpon vanquisher subiects vppon prince captiues vpon mayster condemned vpon iudge pray would beleeue vnlesse sawe ende oracle miracle highly commend oracle delphos one greatest reputation beginning therof may argument rest heard goates sayth diodorus first meane bring credit afterward yoong wench set vtter foorth oracle receyued say priuie partes slaunders grewe thereof ordeyned wench mayd fiftie yeres old circumstance man may gather maner god could cresus therefore beeing desirous knowe bee issewe warres persian oracle answered king craesus passing ouer haty streame shall ouerthrowe proud stately reame cresus gathered hereof ouerthrowe empire persian deede ouerthrew owne thing oracle prouided aforehand making answer doutfull might taken wayes yet greate reason apollo haue preserued cresus singular deuotion greatly inryched temple delphos vnto pyrrhus ennius sayth answered thus say sonne aeacus romanes sure shall ouercome presuming hereuppon ouercome romanes hee ouercome also counseled athenian flee xerxes foretold salaminians ouercome persian either winter sommer perceyueth doutfull speech apollo knew nothing certeinly therefore euer left backedoore scapeout assayes comming foresayings passe douteth themistocles perceiuing puissant armie approche deemed much thereof specially seeing yt afore heard answer apollo counseled countryman wayt enemyes vppon sea number wise senatours good capteynes think wee free city kindomes would haue giuen aduice purpose cace zosimus reporteth palmirenes asked couns whither obteyne empyre east u oracle answered wyse go get ye hence lyke guylfull folke couseners yee thing yee take hand displease goddes see dooth zosimus report whereof maketh greate reckening el wandering generall answer deceytfull douts ye would say shooes fitte feete agreeable folk furthest party aske counsell therefore oenomaus philosopher orator greece hauing oftentymes confesseth bin beguyled oracle delphos gathered register lye thereof set foorth booke ag inst intytled falsehood oracle porphyrius lykewyse made collection euen without adding diminishing chaunging much one woord sayeth vppon examining found ordinarily false addeth cause thereof beporphyrius bookes answere oracle foretelling thing foreknowledge coniectures taken naturall cause mouings meeting starres hath appered many oracle apollo asked one whither haue sonne daughter answered daughter bycause apollo tyme conception venus ouershadowed arares asked another time whither yeere bee vnhealthfull hee anwered yea bycause constellation thereof daungerous loongs thing many wyse woman lerned phisicions would haue answered matter better yet dooing men would haue offered sacrifice vnto nay porphyrius sayeth vpon tyme apollo delphos vnable coniecture starres desired folk let alone telling flatly importunate vppon would answer lye another tyme answered flatly yt instant course starres could shewe nothing pray maner god learne wisdome starres nay worse sayd bee good spirit threaten lye vrged farre good sooth answer coniured deuilles doe yeeld yet still day sorcerer witch whereof italian shall ouercome manfred considered latin two negatiues may counteruayle affirmatiue many like trickes may lesse trouble reade history knowe certeyntie thing demaunded doe wee eyther woorship household take fast hold thereof bookes deliuered euery trybe read openly euery saboth day kept carefully arke arke kept carefully trybes doone appeareth onely booke also effect insewed therof time time footesteps therof euident euen yet among iewes possible booke bee preserued falsifying foysting booke shall byble garded ten hundred thousand men copyed scriueners onely also people afterward reproueth ephorus ephorus find fault timeus consequently timeus reprehendeth wrote afore iosua gathereth certeine vnfallible consequence moyses iudges iosua samuell iudges dauid rest speake prophet sure lawe age age chose rather abyde extremity giue ouer insomuch defended ageinst chananites philistine assyrian babilonians persian greekes romanes durst prowd bold voilate imbace thing hild holy defended many lyues confirmed many deathes yee say heathen intent marre make quyte away profite could haue redounded vnto payne ende haue done could haue corrupted sight knowledge many folke moreouer knoweth scripture caryed banished iewes diuers countryes world afore came hand gentile greekes romanes iewes shooteanker felicitie consisted keeping reward corrupting death could haue benefited haue corrupted nay yet would haue dyed afterward lawe knewe bee corrupted counterfetted soothly see throughout history passed much one halfe hundred yeeres without persecution warres lawe whereas myght sayd suttleheaded fellow among iewes done abuse rest could ageine seeing hand fower fiue prestes ceremony hetrurians latin hand whole people one sillable could chaunged espyed euen yoong child considering also reade king wise euer euer durst presume ad diminish alter whit thereof whereas notwithstanding lawes world made peecemeale king senats haue alwaies reserued selues prerogatiue correct alter pleasure specially limited authoritie serued mayntenance possession man bereeue v argument stepfoorth say scripture historie gathered register many age one author see berosus hath done chaldee duis phenicians manetho egiptians others let tell v hartily pray age world author lykely liued tyme moyses iosua iudges commeth passe wryteth reignes king tyme first king wryteth last king tyme last king possible iewes afore time caryed away diuers place world scattered abroade euerywhere lyke member pentheus carie keepe book moyses men reckoning yet made according booke themselues notwithstading liue also taught nation meane ten trybes name three former remouings scattered ouer whole earth whereof mark apparant denyed first tyme achaz king iuda placea king israell thiglath phalassar king assirians caryed away ruben gad halfe trybe manasses second tyme ose salmanasar caryed away isachar zabulon nepthaly assiria third anon salmanasar conueyed away ephraim half manasses witnessed auncient record many countryes also chronicle hebrewes tyme whyle printing notyet vse meane disperse book soone farre nay say shall find bookes moyses haue bin kept fro father sonne euen vtmost coast ethyopia whither empire neuer came bookes say haue euer since tyme salomon brought thither queene prouince saba thus haue spoken inough matter contented satisfied reason reade scripture haue whereon rest also otherwise hard shewe aught see naught yet tell v tyme machabees antiochus abolished lawe israell al bookes byble think themselues haue made greate speake hard resolued leaue consideration men iudgment whither easie prince though vse neuer great diligece vtterly abolish maner booke whatsoeuer seeing nature man thing sought plucked streyneth keepe booke beleeued reuerenced whole nation delight thing done men therein conteyned saluation man therein reuealed trueth whereof men afrayd indure death torment witnessed many time antiochus diligence man suffise abolish let v put cace abolished iewrie yea abolished throughout whole empire yet insue thereof seeing ten trybes ouer antiochus could haue authoritie caryed disperced abroade vttermost bound world seeing remouing two instant could ye would say ca vp whole stomacke hath euer red iewes made mone losse tooke peyne seeking ageine cut superfluitie speeche whereof commeth manie gramarians beeing opinion become wyse men sought heere behoueth v seeke god turne againe may inioye end tend precept giuen men lawe thou shalt loue god thyne heart thy soule thy strength end bee oppressed pharao turmoyled vp downe ye desert beaten philistine ouerthrowne assyrian caryed away babylonian troden vnder foote nation loue god bring v better reward gayne wee people nay shewe v welfare dwelleth heere belowe host welcome v inne smyling countenace doe cut throtes beddes reward serue god world worldly thing maker man world followeth another precept namely thou shalt loue thy neighbour thy selfe would carneades haue sayd rather would hee haue sayd examined commaundement philosopher sent ambassadour tyme athens rome made oration iustice cato censor whereof spake wonder next day made another wherein proued folly fondnesse romaine fayne come backe againe cotages trafficke whatsoeuer el whereby city made florish would come nought sayd law extendeth farre say doe others would haue done selues also doe others would haue done selues surely welfare consist world goodlier lawe bee man loue himselfe owne wrest neighbour affayres owne profite contrarywise greater fondnesse another man baylie say procure oftentymes man owne losse philosopher ignorant godlinesse roote iustice charitie nothing el rebounding backe loue wee owe vnto god vpon mankind image ayming poynt commaundement beeing restreyned within one worde shall pay fowerfold killeth shalbe punished death much say authoritie one dependeth vpon power authority ye dependeth vpon proof short euen speeche extendeth ordinarily power therefore teacher speaketh another maner learner prince subiect senatour orator maner booke pray speaketh men alike king subiectes greate small old yong learned vnlearned sauing surmounteth capacitie one well neyther intreating perswading man absolutely bidding forbidding al men nother doth say man thou shalt liue recluce within ye precinct thyne owne house thy life long thou shalt lye continual prison thou shalt liue dye euer without ende booke reade wee commaundements ye booke reade punishment reward euery body speaking according abilitie power speech dareth pronounce threaten euerlasting thing partie selfe euerlasing creature speaketh either good creature euill euill creature forbiddeth euill rigorously commaundeth good expresly say better commeth passe mark hee aimeth god glorie welfare bee good creature happeneth hee chalendgeth himselfe belongeth god cannot imparted creature sinne ouerthrewe diuell hell man destruction creature neither good bad remayneth must needes creator leafe whole scripture wee meete matter herewithall wee see thing obseruers lawe read others namely haue yeelded lyues incurred hatred disdeine whole worlde rather would breake despise uerily euen respect none sure serued lawegiuer power ouer barke man ouer present wretched lyfe common lawgiuers haue also power giue either euerlasting lyfe endlesse death appeareth yet lawes giuen men scripture inioyned haue proper place hereafter alledge none thing alreadie proued controuersie unto abraham giuen promisegene seede shall doe seruice strange land bee hardly intreated fower hundred yeeres iudge nation shall haue serued fourth generation shall come hether againe oracle euer foretell thing precisely manifestly long aforehand yet prophesie fulfilled appoynted tyme cannot sayd counterfet moyses leading people israell many turnagaines grounded himselfe vpon none thing stood hand speake prophesie common among deliuered hand hand considering taketh theam ankerhold speake vpon worke vpon soothly receiued abraham receyued moyses put execution iosua iacob made testament aegipt wherein many prophesies word owne childre also trybes come neuerthelesse stand vppon one thou iuda sayth thy brother shall commend thee gene thy father child shall yeeld thee reuerence scepter shall taken iuda law maker fro betweene feete vntill silo come effect hereof scepter shall remayne iuda shall haue souereine iurisdiction vntill tyme messias hebrewes interpret yet ruben simeon leuie eldest brother iacobs house therefore order nature moyses led people israell aegipt trybe leuie iosua brought land canaan ephraim iudges raysed vp one one trybe auother another saule first king chosen people trybe beniamin yoongest thing therefore curst shaking prophesie meane scepter passed saule dauid king yoong shepheard iuda settled euer notwithstanding murmuring ten trybes falling away israell captiuitie babylon whereas sayth vntill silo come sufficed vntill another tyme sapce two thousande yeeres house iuda reigned still israell eldership together direct obserued pedegree thing wee reade stocke world say shall assure v iacob spake thing aske much concerning history knowe moyses haue gayned deuising thereof himselfe trybe leuie giuing ouer charge one trybe ephraim rather bene occasion make iuda strongest al trybes grudge seeing trybe bene authorised iacobs last answer god greatefie iuda afrayd displease ruben simeon leuie rather made prophesie fall vpon leuie authorise himselfe nay gratefying iuda could yet considering iuda excluded tyme came thousand yeeres surely foresayd circumstance well weyed eyther neuer prophesie vncorruptly reported euer must needes touching good philosopher haue prophesying proceed coniunction vnderstanding call possible vnderstanding terme separated meane imagination old men cannot prophesie reason ye weakenesse imaginatiue power wil say iacob older man tha tymerabbi moyses vpo booke abubacher yet notwithstading saw cleerly farre doctrine commonly true yet notwithstanding olde iacob prophesied doeth followe prophesie extraordinarie commeth higher power sayd pretensed vnderstanding wit god prophesying according rule doth followe doctrine false wit prophesying commeth force imagination selues considering weakeneth v cometh inspiration god blessing iacob gaue posteritie matter ought passed ouer lightly hee speaketh partes allotted euery child land canaan made himselfe assigning one seacoast another cornecountrie another vynegrounds euen sort diuided vnto certeine hundred yeeres lot could come knowledge thereof ouerruleth lot seeing foretelling astrologie meane betweene necessitie casuall ptolomie teacheth nothing casual lot maner astrologie iudgeth lotte long aforehand also certeinly chapter going next afore wee reade iacob blessing child ioseph preferred ephraim yonger sonne manasses elder warned thereof father answered ageine deceiued yonger brother bee greater seede growe multitude people arte moued iacob say profit moued moyses contriue ye say phiznomie iudiciarie good old man blind lineamets foreshew whole race constellation shewe shall befall whole nation yet vnborne bee sayde moyses loued one better two speaketh already dead time people come comming yet prophesie fulfilled trybe ephraim alwayes mightier trybe manasses appeareth throughout whole processe history end kingdom tenne trybes grounded chiefly vpon confirmation word oft moyses iosua bookes king chronicle speake two child yongest euer named afore eldest thing vndoubtedly trybe manasses would neuer haue indured without taking exceptio thought themselues haue rested vpon god vpon fancie man shall say moyses hee speaketh people continually conquest chanaan according promise therfore must needes prophesie commonly knowen among deede ioseph picked long time afore buriall nay moreouer moyses deuideth land vnto mynd appointeth arbitrator make partition giueth lawes settle themselues vpon appointeth order keepe setteth doune platformes city suburbes house inioyneth tilling ground resting se th yere feastes solemnity appointest city refuge casuall manslaughter man might say speaking thing father dispose good gotten hee already hand lykelyhod hereof tyme burned bricke aegipt lingered wildernes yea returne men sent spye land reported nothing hardnesse people pray man day part italy greece among v imagination euery v share share lyke would say accxsording prouerbe parted uenison caught yet nomber men haue passed alpes vnder standard sith moyses entered land wayted dyed way yet tyme appointed chananites gaue place people seeth necessitie people driuen man followe moyses yea moyses take vpon leading many distress grounded say vppon man fancie vppon expresse promise vnfallible record beleeued god hee proceedeth yet foresawe chanaan afore came foresawe hee offend god seruing baal came say saw forget god god myndfull wrath hee sawe dispersed scattered ouer fower quarter world troden vnder feete straungers short sawe gentile called god church place yea sawe cleerly foretold songdeuter hee willed preserue hand hand witnesse discharge though top mount nebo could behold land chanaan speake fitly thereof tartarians still mo hath lesse lykelyhod trueth concerning turkes word turk hebrewe signifieth banished men taken way reproche lykely mahomet eschewe offending great nation tyme began awake held still feare god memorial god iudgement moreouer menander ephesian made mention tyrian historie great drought tyme achab king abundance rayne obteyned prayer helias ye imitation whereof greekes feyned like aeacus iosephus witnesseth hee read storie ionas many commentary rife rememberance yet still among arabian affrick touching greatnesse niniuie described fully alike diodorus diodorus li token god gaue ezechias making sunne retyre backe certeyne degree registred chronicle babylonian wisemen persia esay denis hierarchie token say without ground giuen vnto delighted astronomy reformed hebrewe calender many auncient bookes lost might tell v much matter neuerthelesse would fayne haue controller scripture tell haue historie among heathen hath moe witness trewnesse thereof historie iewes whether euen greatest empyres world confirmed history frends historie little nation confirmed enemy whereas obiect wee see myracles day prooue vnto another place like haue bene seene since haue proceeded power enough tyme put remembrance true myracles bene wrought world haue many false myracles among heathen nay say wee haue much name myracle could haue bene giuen first thing exceede abilitie man yea creature thing rightly worthie name remaine absurdity needes finde vnderstand reasonobiections concrneing absurdity law say stand talking beastes pasture ox dosse horne thing base thing word proceedeth god say likewise base thing god create wherefore lawes made benefite man although might seeme vyle respect god denye haue bene profitable respect men tyme men part liued grazing nice fellowes would knowe lawes plato lawes twelue table tyme romanes tilmen grazyers lawes venice fisher yet reuerence lawes antiquitie insomuch wee find old fragment thinke haue iewell emperours rome chief glorie raced digest lawes begin thus cattell venetian statute fisshing frenchman ordinance hunting hawking might many coutries seeme matter laughed day yet euen caryed country necessarie appease strife due tyme place bee short long rome champyonground made lawes harmes cattell fell building made lawes gutter chanels sinkes began seeke ruine men made lawes battell warfare sacking city listed destroye selfe made lawes rebellion prescription banishment alike behoofull necessarie tymes first lawmaker lesse honored latter howbeit state commonweale worse corrupted latter tyme whereas former tymes repressing beast ye latter tymes deale brydling men worse wyld beastes speake truely men become wood beastes themselues ad god say created thing yet notwithstanding moyses denounceth beastes bee cleane vncleane whereto may bee good ought consider oftentimes thing themselues cleane become vncleane abuse like thing good wholsome nature becommeth euill vnwholsome excesse surfeting respect hath wine bin prohibited among many people fewe haue abhorred beastes others maner wee see rome murthered father moothers put sacke ape cock uiper cast water thing whereof vneasie yeeld reason sayd law moyses vnprofitable ne tending higher present life without cause put difference betweene brute thingsorigen ageinst celsus lib looke well denouceth al brute thing vncleane whereby aegiptians made diuinations tooke foretoken woolfe foxe dragon hare sparehauke kyte foorth make people israell abhorre vanity abhominations aegipt like man would keepe child fire would prohibite euen chimney abuse knowen among end aimingpoynt lawe redresse therefore vppon poynt desire despisers suspend iudgement thing vnderstand tyme fault found difference lawe moyses fault found many others day wee could set v gentile esay nine fiftie redeemer threescore one phisition helplesse proclaymer acceptable yere lord threescore two sauiour league attonement bringeth people lordeth holy giueth lawes nation earth hath word god owne mouth mouthes seede sauing kingdome christ god giue better place straungers al prophet like shoote marke haue voyce neuerthelesse content ourselues feawe saying shall giue credit vnto dauid sayeth lord hee shall reigne king prosper execute iustice iudgment vppon earth ye aske prophet maner prosperitie shalbe sayeth dayes iuda shalbe safe israel shal dwell without feare name whereby shalbe called shalbe euerlasting ryghtuousenes say iustifier v sayeth lord hath sayd dauid shall neuer want successor sitting vppon throne neither shall euer want priest priest leuites offer sacrifice neither possible breake couenant breake couenant haue made day nyght iewes cannot denie euen record owne paraphrast text ment christ yet notwithstanding hath wanted successor dauid leuie present text others purpose daniel second seuenth chapter expounding nabugodonozors dreame treateth fower greate monarchy rise vp world euery one tyme betokened vnder fower metalls golde siluer brasse yron dreame representeth v stone heawen without hand stryketh image yron feete breaketh apeeces much told v kingdom messias shall seeme small stuffe without stay without force man yet shall indure away blud haue yet cleansed wit gentile lord shall dwell syon speaketh another iewrie another syon wit spirituall one church end tendeth amos amos sayth set vp tabernacle dauid againe stop vp breakes religion sothen religion israell haue three mark true religionthe conclusion three markes true religion israel namely true god lawe god mediator saluation beseeche men sooke well see whether find elsewhere religion haue bin old time nay asfor sted true god shall find diuells men stock sted god woord inlyghten v soulehealth shall find doutfull oracle answer idolls vayne fond without ground without end speake whit god glorie man welfare insted sufficient mediator wee shall find sort wasshings passe skin shall find manslaughter sacrifising wretched kaytifs condemned misdeedes religion god religion certeine god speaketh healthful one meane attonement certesse therefore let v say israell true religion israell schoole universitie founded god wherein voutsafed teache men myght learne owne saluation behold yet one obiection ageinst godobiections happeneth say schoole among people nation leastwise well man becommeth man hold peace god speaketh yeeld whatsoeuer haue done thou art ryghtuous farre foorth thou doest rightuous deedes god farre otherwise thing rightuous furtherfoorth hee doeth neuerthelesse pray thee canst thou say adam god creator made mankynd adam al mankynd forlorne wisdom creator stepping byandby reuealeth woord vttereth promise mediator men thou seest distinction nation people adam child imbraced seruice god promise forsooke regarded say tooke part diuell othersome stacke gracious goodnesse god haste thou alledge ageinst rightuousenes creator followeth general corruption mankynd god exhorteth noe repentance threatening wrath otherwise still refuse god mercy drowned iustice sauing noe household saued arke men hitherto onely one people still god woord reuealing directed still al men ageine ye see arke al mankind gatherd ageine one howsehold tyme difference circumcysed vncircumcysed iew gentyle anon turned away vnto idolls forsooke couenant god made hath cause honour patientnes god bearing woonder suffered men take owne wayes rather voutsafed reserue men aliue world yet notwithstanding euen tyme chose abraham mids idolatrie manifested new ageine vnto vttered secret vnto deliuered promise pawne entered couenant seede thing doone alonly seede blesse nation kinreds earth partye borne seede renue couenant seeth couenant offered nation howbeit refused god infinite mercy renewed abraham renewed effect men thou desirest god iust yet wouldest thou also continew still iust maner thou wouldest haue iust thou hadst bene vndone adam thou hadst bene swept away flud thou hadst bene destroyed ye ouerflowing vngoddlines idolatrie ye flud thou hadst say bene either vtterly fordone continued forlorne euer thus desirest thou thing contrarie themselues contrary thine owne meaning therefore appeale god iustice cry vnto mercy thy hand yet thy desiring mercy grace yet another error yt thou wilt needes appoint maner measure thereof thou wilt haue thy pleasure whereas notwithstanding according thy deuice thou wouldest find fault thou hadst liked well another man would haue misliked aduice couldest thou haue giuen creating thee wast counsell wouldest thou giue recreating thee art ye worse thou hast already thou wouldest god haue reuealed alyke men beginning well reuelations tend mediator mediator must god man man behoueth bee borne one stocke thou seest priuiledge must needes befall one certeine stocke saue men cannot borne men thou romane gloriousenes thy citie seeme deserue yet babylon niniue stand contention thee athens thinke lesse regarded hir learning sake much speedyer way v cut stryfe yeelding vnto god sayeth case standeth vpon merit vpon mercy intent al men may perceyue wil haue welfare al kingdomes come hillocke hidden middest world digging downe whereof haue taken soo much peynes pleasure lesse hillok growe proud wil make spring top foote thereof head citie little village vnregarded yea moreouer shall see hereafter springeth vp shall refused straungers shall set fireobiections insomuch foundation kingdome thereof layd one stone shalnot left standing vppon another let wyse men world wey circumstance yea euen according owne wisdome seeing saluation reward free fauour recompence desert thing concerneth god glorie finall ende thing man vanitie let tell mee mediator man saluation could bee borne mystery comming ought rather bestowed israell yet notwithstanding consider still circumstance world shall still found vnexcusable first kingdomes siria assiria persia arabie egipt vppon border kingdomes hierusalem stoode watchtower looke lanterne giue lyght nation round empire began remoue lesser asia greece italy see god prouidence disperse iewes sinagogues throughout whole world preacher true god schooles seruice heraults mediator come bring saluation mankynd forasmuch ende religion man saluation end scripture christ mediator bringer thereof must hencefoorth see hath bin promised tyme tyme since first beginning whether hee haue bin exhibited world tyme aforelimited souereintie maner iurisdiction ceassed hierusalem haue taken sure token messias doores therefore let v see alteration come passe peculiar tyme came passe saule say newe rabbines chosen king silo trybe beniamin may thing spoken hym nay sayd scepter shall depart iuda seeing scepter bene iuda come trybe vntill dauid afterward anointed king scripture rather haue sayd scepter shall iuda vntill haue bene iewes nay vespasian titus domitian adrian diuers emperours rome haue indeuered roote whole house iuda trybe iuda haue sought coceale themselues manifestly corrupt owne pedegrees rid themselues rigorous inquisition made insomuch day iewe report mee themselues whether say true vaunt hath pedegree certein yea shew lykely coniecture hee trybe iuda say blud royall christ promised haue sayd written owne history confirmed afterward also heathen writer wrate life emperour adrian yet still wasted caryed away spayne hierusalem peopled nation whole land iewrie made vtterly heathen many went afterward abuse iewes vnder pretence one long since italie destroyed welnere wyped cleane rememberance let v adde yet since tyme aboue fifteene hundred yeeres agoe neuer prophetes comfort god extraordinarie gift knowledge tribe euident token prophesies amed chiefly christ fulfilled church comforted indewed giftes hoped bee short whose sake pedegrees kept certeyne borne therefore wee see doe say rabbi hillel day ezechias haue swallowed vp messias say bee looked folke haue made themselues vnworthie others extremitie despayre pronounce accursed determine certeyne tyme comming messias incling thereof ad shalbe hidden sower hundred yeeres greate sea eight hundred yeres among sonnes coree fower score yeres gate rome rabbi iosua sonne leuy saith talmud himselfe sawe lapping vp sore among lazermen thing euen none witnesse selues tale contriued vpon pleasure purpose mock folke say shalbe set vp great honour next vnto pope end shall say pope moyses pharao let people goe may serue mee foorth borne long agoe keepe selfe secret say talmud till called deliuer cause keepe away still seeing haue called much lowd many hundred yeres seeing also time expyred yea almost dubble expyred finally seeing euen according owne exposition sayd hasten tyme answere yet still remayneth good repentace tooto miserable surely god preuent repentance grace repentance best menin treatise sanhed ca helec sorynesse cannot sory enough let v heere pretie dialogue two rabbins disputing talmud matter written sayth rabbi eliezer turne againe yee stubborne child ieremy heale stybbornesse esay yea also written sayth r iosua ye haue bene sold nothing ye shall redeemed mony say ye haue bene sold idolatryes nothing ye shalbe redeemed without repentance good workes yea sayd sayth r eliezer turne yee mee turne malachy let v also reade sayth r iosua haue taken ye mariage wyfe take one citie twoo household giue enterance sion r eliezer replyeth thus sayd ye shalbe saued calmnesse rest nay sayth r iosua written esay esay thus saith lord redeemer israell despised soule people abhorred say wickednes shal stop course god decree daniel end eliezer sayth meaneth ieremy say thou turne thee ageine israell seeing conditionall maner speaking nay saith rabbi iosua ment daniel text heard man clothed linnen stood vppon water riuer lifted vp right hand left hand vp heauen sware liueth euer shalbe tyme tymes halfe tyme talmud sayth tert r eliezer blankt held peace much say condescended r iosua sayd namely offence israell stay comming christ god would preuent israell holy grace agein want generall conuersion withhold comming messias considering punishment lyeth vppon nation vniuersall banishment long continuance farre whome much temple cittie countrie destroyed may much see farre cryme exceeding great vniuersall continuall among meane fault peculiar nation common nation world first temple say destroyed idolatrie superfluitie sheading giltlesse blud specially blud zacharie esay yet notwithstanding wanted prophetes time captiuitie nay neuer mo mercifully god measure comfortes according affliction bee sayd seeing many hundred yeres haue bene comforted euen day lesse giuen idolatrie seeming constant lawe effect lesse giuen royot lesse bluddy euer nay seeing vnder second temple shewed great zeale romaine admitted idolatrie among chose rather dye thousand deathes onely receiue either emperours image romayne standard peinted eagle insomuch left breache wall citie vngarded rather would breake sabboth day might cause god withold open manifestation messias affirme haue bene borne tyme multiply misery extreemely say worshipping golden calfe wildernes say fault committed two three thousand yeres ago notwithstanding people presently punished hand many recoueries messias come prepare hart israelite battell malachie expoundeth himselfe fitly wordes shall turne heart father child say shall exhort israell repentance obiectionsan obiection idolatry ceasse insewe hereafter haue little weight written destroy idolles earth alsoesay hungerstarue god gentyles againezach shall serue mee one shoulder would god abuse crept christian church christes ordinanceso phony great stumbling blocke iewes neuerthelesse let consider great nomber god woorshipped assyrian persian greekes romaine tyme euery countrey euery citie euery household euery person peculiar god idol himselfe shall finde within little ye apostle preached doctrine iesus world gone much rememberance remayned publishing glorie god wee also declared ouerthrowe let reade history heathen aske become oracle meane deuilles hild lye dreames would bee pacified sacrificing men yea euen owne child wickedness taken roote world throughout shew print euen tyme tyberius began men aske question namely cause oracle spake deuils wrought done aforetymes priestes wanted liuing heathen themselues driuen answer since tyme iesus dyed disciple preached abroade arte magicke deuils lost power sodeine vniuersall wonderfull enemy chaunge tyme great force onely name iesus mouth poore men king emperours kingdomes empyres vpholders worshipper deuilles idol briefnesse sake omit obiectionan obiection ageinst alteration religion made christ following nation haue followed iesus prophet haue tolde v remnant shall bee saued iesus himselfe sayth many called fewe chosen suffiseth voyce gospell hath bene heard ouer world gate church set open nation againe come issewe know word col say betokeneth men without exception shall followe nation without difference shall bee people againe seede christ say euerlasting see seede iesus bee say well word seede meane christ disciple owne language terme sonnes child thankes lord disciple still euerywhere whole world principall obiection remayneth yet behind iesus sonne god say chaungeth lawe god father deliuered moyses beeing hath bene sayd alreadie holy inuiolable doth hee bee receiued messias surely poynt charge iesus changing abolishing law flat contrarie affirming change abolish plainly expounded fulfilled nay say circumcision expressely commaunded god vnto abraham afterward moyses th hath iesus abolished deede thing doth alwaies deceiue affirme saying expresse lawe concerneth monethly disease woman yet shall ceasse reigne say messias alledge concerning circumcision sabboth feast easter others sayd thy shalbe legnolam leuit say interpretation euer wee haue learned word legnolam signifieth euer deut long tyme tyme long continuance without intermission breaking rather continuance tyme without end sence doe reade sayd samuel shall abide presence lord legnolam euer midrasch vpo place commentarie sayth age leuites leuiticall age say continuance fiftie yeres likewise seruant whose eare maister boared sayd shalbe thy seruant legnolam euer place commentarie saythr dauid kimhi booke rootes prouerb vntill yeere iubil therfore great grammarian rabbi kimhi sayth legnolam signifieth long tyme according saying prouerbes olde bound buttel hath continued long tyme vseth word legnolam word whereby hebrewes vse commonly betoken tyme without end gnad netsach selah legnolam vagned god ment sending sonne christ make new couenant seruing thy neighbour neede commaundements second table saith thou shalt honour thy father thy moother howbeit thy heart fashion sake thou shalt doo lyke thy superiours thou shalt uot kill yea thou hate thy neighbour onely also euen thyne enemy thou art manslear already thou shalt steale man haue thy cote thee thou shalt let haue thy cloke thou shalt beare false witnesse word either false hurtfull also ydle thou shalt commit aduoutry thou doe looke vpon woman lust vnto thou hast committed adultrie already moreouer little leaue hast thou couet man good succor thou must dispossesse thy bee stoned name iesus let v heare contrarie part voyce worldly conquerourplutark saying king old tyme whosoeuer followe sayth cyrus lacedemonians footman make horseman bee horseman giue charyot haue themselues cyrus great emperour could haue lacedemonians serue great offer iesus poore abiect vnregarded rigorous threat euen suffering reprochfull death manacing like follower drawe people nation vnto souldyers also emperours city also whole empyres cyrus dyed conquering iesus conquered dying death cyrus decayed owne kingdome bodie without soule death iesus inlarged kingdome euen ouer empyres could haue bene death iesus life empyres kingdomes seeth mightinesse one humaine weakenesse weakenesse diuine mightinesse wee woonder conquest alexander beeing meane king macedonie passed asia conquered fortie thousand men moe caryed hundred thousand would haue lesse estimation deedes much greater account would haue made done halfe number done tenth man would haue wondered wee made god conquering diuine honor would think sufficiet leastwise would haue thought god yet least assisted power might god souldiers ouercome enemy beate hand conquered causing themselues bee killed brought kingdomes obedience submitting themselues gibbet bene cryme haue left vnwoorshipped god betweene able man vnable man skilfull vnskilfull difference bee vnskilfull doe nothing vnlesse haue well abundantly wherewith skilfull worke much vpon little cunning ouercome awknesse stuffe difference betweene skilfullest man god man little make somewhat whereas god nothing without helpe thing make great thing yea euen one contrary another another much say infinite power able fill vp infinite distance betweene contrary specially betweene nothing something let v see iesus hath done let v bring v eye reason wee iudging discerning historie alexander first lord iesus borne destitute al worldly help ten tenthousand tenthousand ten million men doe atteyne atteyne nothing huge thing accompanyed fewe ignorant fisherman grosse wit yet small matter yt could cause giue ouer trade follow instrument make preacher whole world rather cleane contrary purpose incourage sayes vnto blessed ye ye indure maner aduersities name sake bene enough haue driuen away yet followe length sendeth ambassage al nation message taketh vp crosse followeth worthie would day take charge vpon though well rewarded labour shall whippe synagog sayth would vndertake deale case specially vppon perswasion hee saue life shall lose ende dyeth crucified betweene two theeues fewe follower wit end leaueth neither child kinsfolke behinde vpholde sillie kingdome kingdome heauen talked seemeth bee buryed earth worldly kingdome perished plight long throne alexander reigne notwithstanding vphild hope child policie great capteynes force victorious army terrour name meane sillie sheepe christ came together wet preached hierusalem afterward world preached iesus bene crucified behoued beleeue man vayne god absurd yet notwithstanding may haue audience teach men suffer shut rather dye forbeare speake bee accused preach cryme iudges malefactor tormented make tell fault tormented make conceale hold peace saue themselues death dye speaking persecutor crye miserie cannot ouercome old man woman shame v wearie tormenting bee torment yet notwithstanding lesse fortie yeeres ye world filled full doctrine country conquered iesus christ fewe disciple preaching bludshed sheading owne hierusalem spayne yea hierusalem indyes looke meanes kingdome founded also stablished tyme tyme increased mainteyned man knowe farre man extend attribute thing vnto man hee god sayth wise man doth creature euer thing either afore iesus also aristotle sayth nothing nothing bee made deede rule nature el doings christ making thing also yt greatest thing nothing vyolate ouercome lawe nature created nature god spake word done surpasseth nature iesus sayth doth take vp crosse followe worthie fleshly vnderstanding much say flee yet men followe seeke word say enough driue v away draweth v vnto disswading perswadeth v turning v away turneth v throwing v downe setteth v vp killing v maketh v euerlasting drawe one contrarie another effect water fire effect fire water made fire water drawe perswasion disswading conuerting diuerting made heart man hearkeneth speech partie speaketh conquering liuing dying himselfe ye would say working effect taking away cause subduing world disarming tying deliuering himselfe taking way contrarie businesse choosing instrument cotrarie working doth thing instrument contrarie thereunto nay rather instrument directly hurtfull way doth shew could word without helpe let v see yet nature make something nothing philosopher must stoope nature make thing speaking contrarie orator put silence wilt thou say besides bee extreame resistance thing selfe thou phisition complexion thou bee capteyne conquest thou orator willes men alexander great thing fewe men graunt men made head might haue done case bin let v see contrarywise resistance men made generally particulerly shut iesus ye doores ye speake force could scarsly preach without perill death apostle could open lippes thei whipped stoned racked crucyfied burned cruellest emperours caligula nero domitian others wrought vpon chiefe deedes cruelty emperours chaunced bee mield iustice vsed forsooth bee sedicious say let sought come question wherefore soeuer let escape would fayne learne sect philosopher greece would haue ceassed least commaundement magistrate trueth doe finde monument conquest ouer world trueth iesus christ ye haue eye policie followed excluded promotion office hell man ambicious nature child prohibited goe schoole cutting vp tree ye roote growen grace heauen also certeyne counterfet dialog forged concerning pylate christ full wicked lye blasphemy inioyned bee read schooles conned child hart steyne name iesus make odious lothsome men euer pernicious policie could deuill himselfe haue deuised iewes worse others notwithstanding promised false traytors whereas haue preached eagerly accuse insomuche scarsly came disciple towne made hew crye vppon murder nay euery seuerall persone inward incounter extreame resistance ageinst word yea sayd men within themselues shall beleeue iesus abiect man crucified god shal beleeue disciple ofscourings world outcast iewes shall beleeue two three dayes leaue behind wretched wyfe reprochefull rememberance report foole posteritie emperours made cruell warre ageinst doctrine swoord lawes may well coniecture warre euery man maynteyned ageinst haue knowen persecution let v bethink v battells betweene flesh spirit lyuely sharpe argument man cace maketh ageinst notwithstanding end whole nation yeelded themselues word men euen empyres worshipped iesus christ crucified weakenesse wrought force get vpper hand foly wisdome tryumph ouer manhod multitude preuayle surely iesus sonne god repayred world spirit god created first word cicero could woonder ynough romulus sayeth time rude compassed much called god certesse maruell cicero shewed grosse behalf called god euer beleeued rome tyme long tyme rout ignorant silly shepherd thereby wee may deeme iudgment hee would haue giuen vppon iesus romulus called god senate beleeued senate put people feare meanes made say whole empyre rome could scare one disciple professing iesus resemblance betweene two may sayd alexander greate emperour made men woorship god euen army fall mutiny lost estimation disteyned victory owne howseholdseruants contented beaten rather would kneele downe woorship asfor caligula domitian heliogabalus others laughed skorne long liued soone dead godhead dragged myre lyke doggs men voutsafed much tumb buryed say yee iesus despysed lyfetyme woorshipped god death gasings playnly bewrayed effect thereof supposed coniunctions gaue iudgment christen religion continue aboue three hundred threescore yeeres thereabouts manifest ouerthrowe maner vngodlynes cosciences sumon v often appeare men sith soule cheefely receyueth commaundement cheefely breaketh soule must come examination tryall cannot done world wherein shadowe iustice whose lawes iudges extend outter sidemidrasch psalm esay psalm c therefore wee see auncient rabines speake often general iudgment attribute messias saying feare god iudge iudge owne fellow citizen owne kinsman owne brother auntient gentyles haue spoken iudgement say shall bee giuen another lyfe feeld truthe whereuppon shall followe eyther endlesse lyfe endlesse death haue shewed afore yea seemeth lending religion primitiue churche badge comfort christian hath made sume call creede ye apostle beleeue god father almyghty maker heauen earth c beleeue trust trust hope good thing hand vayne hope reached present world haue declared heretofore one god god created world manchapt man owne glorie nothing guydeth prouidence one according nature steady suresettled lawe prescribed world according wit hath giuen way euer man take frameth alwayes holy end hath appoynted man immortall created leade endlesse lyfechapt lyfe souereine welfare good alonly content man satisfie witchapt therefore must tend indeuer thither heart bend power wit end short meane man atteine thereuntochapt serue true god al hart soule strength say vow thought wordes deedes glorie god sayd also man falne originallchapt pryde disobedience first man whereuppon hath followed frowardnes ignorance wit ignorance making vnable discerne owne welfare frowardnes turning away yea euen shewed making vnwoorthy atteyne finally causing abuse ability power euill consequently plunging gulf al miserie according owne desert according iustice god whereuppon insueth man forlorne vnlesse god recouer mercy blind except god inlyghten ageine vtterly lame good atteynement good vntill god grace releeue himchapt therefore sayd hath left v religion guyde religion turneth v creature vanitie conuerteth v creator heauen earth religion israelytes chapt al place nothing seruice diuells idolatrie religion israell keeping custodie word reuelations promise giuing v lawe rule liue whereby conuicteth v naughtynesse inuyteth v call god gracechapt old testament lawe moyses prophet haue proued haue proceeded god haue bin inspyred end hauing condemned v offereth v grace hauing giuen iudgement vpon v sendeth v pardon steadeth v surety able pay deptschapt surety messias promised iewes saluation whole world mediator mankynd god man exhibited world due tyme bee sauyour iewes lyght gentyles euen iesus christ sonne god chapt beleeue according percell creede iesus christ sonne lord conceyued holy ghoste borne virgin mary crucified dead rizen agein foorth al poynts haue proued ageinst iewes gentyles ageinst iewes scripture ageinst gentyles reason themselues say take guyde owne record creede addeth beleeue holy ghoste also haue shewed bee three inbeings one essence beingchap acknowledged iewes gentyles namely father sonne holy ghoste
